title: House to Vote on Booting Chinese Stocks From U.S. Over Audit Rules
sub_head: Alibaba, other companies could be forced to relocate listings overseas
body:
WASHINGTON—Lawmakers next week are likely to force Chinese companies with shares traded on American exchanges to finally comply with audit-oversight rules—or leave U.S. markets altogether.
House leaders plan to consider a measure as early as Wednesday that would force Chinese firms such as Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. either to transition to getting an annual audit that is reviewed by U.S. regulators, or remove the shares from trading in the U.S. The House plans to vote under rules that limit debate and require a two-thirds...
